extendedMetadata.value: LO: 7.5: Why were some Federalists willing to sacrifice political freedoms for party advantage?

subject: US History
metadata.bookAuthor: H. W. Brands; T. H. Breen; R. Hal Williams; Ariela J. Gros
metadata.title: PRE 07 13

config.question: By the statement “We are all republicans; we are all federalists,” Jefferson meant that __________.

choices.content: Americans were committed to a federal union based on republican ideals
he would appoint both Republicans and Federalists to his cabinet
party differences were no longer important
his party would strive toward giving the states more power

answer_3.response: In his inaugural address, Jefferson said, “We are all republicans; we are all federalists.” Jefferson meant that whatever the politicians might say, the people shared a deep commitment to a federal union based on republican ideals, set forth during the American Revolution.

answer_2.response: In his inaugural address, Jefferson said, “We are all republicans; we are all federalists.” Jefferson meant that whatever the politicians might say, the people shared a deep commitment to a federal union based on republican ideals, set forth during the American Revolution.

answer_1.response: In his inaugural address, Jefferson said, “We are all republicans; we are all federalists.” Jefferson meant that whatever the politicians might say, the people shared a deep commitment to a federal union based on republican ideals, set forth during the American Revolution.
